children.value: These should not, because they occur within a code block:

Backslash: \\

Backtick: \`

Asterisk: \*

Underscore: \_

Left brace: \{

Right brace: \}

Left bracket: \[

Right bracket: \]

Left paren: \(

Right paren: \)

Greater-than: \>

Hash: \#

Period: \.

Bang: \!

Plus: \+

Minus: \-

Quote: \"

Dollar: \$

Percentage: \%

Ampersand: \&

Single quote: \'

Comma: \,

Forward slash: \/

Colon: \:

Semicolon: \;

Less-than: \<

Equals: \=

Question mark: \?

At-sign: \@

Caret: \^

New line: \
only works in paragraphs.
Nor should these, which occur in code spans:

These should get escaped, even though they're matching pairs for
other Markdown constructs:
This is a code span with a literal backslash-backtick sequence:
This is a tag with unescaped backticks
This is a tag with backslashes
